contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:Template:Infobox writer/doc]] --> | image = Hector_Malot.jpg | imagesize = 220px | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date|1830|5|20}} | birth_place = [[La Bouille]], [[France]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1907|7|17|1830|5|20}} | death_place = [[Fontenay-sous-Bois]], [[France]] }} '''Hector Malot''' (May 20, 1830 - July 17, 1907) was a French writer born in [[La Bouille]], [[Seine-Maritime]]. He studied law in Rouen and [[Paris]], but eventually literature became his passion. He worked as a dramatic critic for ''Lloyd Francais'' and as a literary critic for ''L'Opinion Nationale''. His first book, published in 1859, was ''Les Amants''. In total Malot wrote over 70 books. By far his most famous book is ''[[Sans Famille]]'' (''Nobody's Boy'', 1878), which deals with the travels of the young orphan Remi, who is sold to the street musician Vitalis at age 10. ''Sans Famille'' gained fame as a children's book, though it was not originally intended as such. He announced his retirement as an author of fiction in 1895, but in 1896 he returned with the novel ''L'amour Dominateur'' as well as the account of his literary life ''Le Roman de mes Romans'' (''The Novel of my Novels''). He died in [[Fontenay-sous-Bois]] in 1907.
